definitions: device used to secretly monitor and record telephone conversations or electronic communications
examples: The detective obtained a court order to place a wiretap on the suspect's phone
They discovered an illegal wiretap hidden in the conference room

definitions: system of electrical cables and connections installed in a building or device
examples: The old house needed complete rewiring to meet safety standards
Check the wiring diagram before connecting the new stereo system

definitions: V-shaped bone from a bird's chest traditionally broken for making wishes
examples: They saved the wishbone from the Thanksgiving turkey for good luck
The children each grabbed one side of the wishbone and pulled

definitions: act of hoping or expressing a desire for something to happen or be true
examples: Her constant wishing for better times kept her spirits up
The wishing well in the park collected coins from hopeful visitors

definitions: small thin bunch or strand of hair, smoke, cloud, or similar substance
examples: A wisp of smoke rose from the extinguished candle
She tucked a wisp of hair behind her ear

definitions: woody climbing plant with hanging clusters of fragrant purple, blue, or white flowers
examples: The wisteria draped beautifully over the garden archway
Purple wisteria blooms covered the entire side of the house

definitions: mental sharpness and inventiveness characterized by quick clever humor
person known for clever amusing remarks and quick thinking
examples: Her sharp wit made every conversation entertaining and memorable
He relied on his wit to navigate difficult social situations
The famous wit entertained guests at every dinner party
Shakespeare was considered one of the greatest wits of his time

definitions: practice of magic involving spells and supernatural powers traditionally associated with witches
examples: The villagers accused her of practicing witchcraft in the forest
Ancient books on witchcraft lined the shelves of the occult shop

definitions: act of removing or taking away something, especially money from an account
physical and mental symptoms experienced when stopping addictive substance use
examples: She made a large withdrawal from her savings account yesterday
The army's withdrawal from the region took several weeks to complete
The patient experienced severe withdrawal symptoms after quitting alcohol
Withdrawal from certain medications should be done under medical supervision

definitions: severely critical or scornful remarks or looks that make someone feel ashamed
examples: She silenced him with a withering glance across the room
The critic's withering review destroyed the playwright's confidence completely

definitions: act of refusing to give or keeping back something such as information, money, or permission
examples: The withholding of evidence led to a mistrial in court
Tax withholding from paychecks helps people budget throughout the year

definitions: informal term for someone exceptionally skilled or clever at something
examples: She's a real wiz at solving complex math problems quickly
The computer wiz fixed our network issues in minutes

definitions: person with magical powers, especially in legends and fairy tales
software feature that guides users through complex tasks step by step
examples: The wizard cast a powerful spell to protect the kingdom
Merlin was the most famous wizard in Arthurian legend
Use the installation wizard to set up your new software
The wizard walked her through creating her first spreadsheet

definitions: practice of magic or impressive skill that seems almost magical in nature
examples: His wizardry with numbers amazed everyone at the accounting firm
The chef's culinary wizardry transformed simple ingredients into masterpieces

definitions: unsteady rocking motion from side to side or back and forth
examples: The table had an annoying wobble whenever anyone touched it
She noticed a wobble in her bicycle wheel after the accident

definitions: great sorrow, distress, or trouble affecting a person or group
examples: The refugees shared tales of woe from their dangerous journey
Financial woes forced the company to declare bankruptcy last year

definitions: large bowl-shaped frying pan used in Chinese cooking for stir-frying
examples: Heat the wok before adding oil for authentic stir-fry results
She bought a new wok from the Asian grocery store

definitions: mythical creature that transforms from human into wolf, especially during full moon
examples: The wolfman terrorized the village every month during the full moon
Classic horror movies often featured the wolfman as a tragic character

definitions: stocky muscular carnivorous mammal resembling a small bear native to northern regions
examples: The wolverine defended its territory fiercely against larger predators
Wolverines have incredibly strong jaws that can crush frozen bones

definitions: state or condition of being an adult woman including qualities traditionally associated with women
examples: She celebrated her daughter's transition into womanhood with a special ceremony
The book explored different cultural perspectives on womanhood throughout history

definitions: man who engages in numerous casual sexual relationships with women
examples: His reputation as a womanizer made serious relationships difficult
The womanizer finally settled down after meeting the right person

definitions: organ in female mammals where offspring develop before birth, also called uterus
examples: The baby developed in the womb for nine months
Ultrasound technology allows doctors to monitor babies in the womb

definitions: short-legged muscular marsupial native to Australia that burrows underground
examples: The wombat emerged from its burrow to feed on grass
Wombats can weigh up to 35 kilograms when fully grown

definitions: basic monetary unit of South Korea and North Korea
examples: She exchanged her dollars for won at the Seoul airport
The price was listed as 10,000 won in the shop window

definitions: place full of wonderful things or magical quality that inspires delight and amazement
examples: The children's eyes widened as they entered the winter wonderland
Alice's adventures took her through a strange and magical wonderland

definitions: person's habitual practice or customary behavior done regularly over time
examples: As was his wont, he arrived exactly five minutes early
It was her wont to take long walks every Sunday morning

definitions: person who creates decorative objects or sculptures by cutting and shaping wood
examples: The woodcarver spent months creating an intricate totem pole
Local woodcarvers displayed their handmade bowls at the craft fair

definitions: art or craft of carving decorative objects from wood using special tools
examples: The intricate woodcarving on the church door depicted biblical scenes
She took up woodcarving as a relaxing hobby after retirement

definitions: plump woodland bird with long bill used for probing soft ground for food
examples: The woodcock uses its flexible bill tip to find earthworms underground
Hunters prize woodcock for their challenging flight patterns

definitions: knowledge and skills related to living, traveling, and surviving in wooded areas
examples: His excellent woodcraft helped the group navigate through the dense forest
The scout leader taught woodcraft skills including fire-starting and shelter-building

definitions: print made from design cut into wooden block used in artistic printmaking
examples: The medieval book featured beautiful woodcut illustrations on every page
She created a woodcut print of her garden for holiday cards

definitions: person whose job involves cutting down trees and chopping wood for fuel
examples: The woodcutter worked from dawn until dusk in the forest
In fairy tales, woodcutters often discover magical creatures

definitions: land covered with trees and undergrowth smaller than a forest
examples: The ancient woodland provided habitat for many rare species
They bought a house near peaceful woodland for weekend retreats

definitions: person who works in forest cutting timber or managing woodland areas
examples: The experienced woodman knew every trail in the forest
Woodmen cleared fallen trees after the severe winter storm

definitions: bird with strong bill that drills holes in tree bark to find insects
examples: The woodpecker's rhythmic tapping echoed through the morning forest
Red-headed woodpeckers store acorns in holes they drill in trees

definitions: family of musical instruments producing sound by blowing air through wooden tube
examples: The orchestra's woodwind section includes flutes, oboes, and clarinets
She played several woodwind instruments before choosing the saxophone

definitions: wooden parts of a building such as doors, stairs, and decorative moldings
examples: The Victorian house featured elaborate woodwork throughout every room
Termites had damaged the woodwork in the basement

definitions: skill or activity of making things from wood using various tools and techniques
examples: His woodworking hobby evolved into a successful furniture business
The woodworking class taught students to use both hand and power tools

definitions: deep barking sound made by a dog
horizontal threads in woven fabric that cross the warp
examples: The big dog's loud woof scared away the intruder
A deep woof from behind the fence made them jump
The woof threads determine the fabric's texture and strength
She chose colorful yarn for the woof in her weaving project

definitions: act of seeking romantic affection or trying to gain someone's love
examples: His persistent wooing finally won her heart after many months
The wooing process included flowers, poetry, and romantic dinners

definitions: soft curly hair forming the coat of sheep used to make yarn and fabric
examples: The sheep's wool was sheared every spring for making sweaters
Pure wool blankets provide excellent warmth during cold winters

definitions: cloth or garment made from wool fiber with fuzzy texture
examples: She wrapped herself in a warm woolen shawl
The shop specialized in traditional woolen goods from Scotland

definitions: British spelling of woolen referring to items made from wool
examples: The woollen mill produced high-quality fabrics for winter coats
He wore his favorite woollen jumper on cold days

definitions: way in which something is expressed using particular words and phrases
examples: The contract's wording was deliberately vague to avoid legal issues
She spent hours perfecting the wording of her wedding vows

definitions: clever or humorous use of words exploiting different meanings or similar sounds
examples: Shakespeare's plays are famous for their brilliant wordplay and puns
The comedian's wordplay had the entire audience laughing

definitions: person who compulsively works excessively hard and long hours
examples: The workaholic rarely took vacations or spent time with family
Being a workaholic eventually affected his health and relationships
